docs.text: Mkdocs Github deploy Examples of deploying an Mkdocs site to Github pages. Way 1 - Using mkdocs gh-deploy In your .github/workflows/ci.yml : name: ci on: push: branches: - main permissions: contents: write jobs: deploy: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - name: Configure Git Credentials run: | git config user.name github-actions[bot] git config user.email 41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com - uses: actions/setup-python@v4 with: python-version: 3.x - run: echo "cache_id=$(date --utc '+%V')" >> $GITHUB_ENV - uses: actions/cache@v3 with: key: mkdocs-material-${{ env.cache_id }} path: .cache restore-keys: | mkdocs-material- - run: pip install mkdocs-material - run: mkdocs gh-deploy --force On pushes to the main branch: Checkout at the Github repo Set Git credentials Setup python Cache some artifacts Install dependencies Use mkdocs gh-deploy This follows the documentation found here . The ci.yml is copied from the Material for Mkdocs documentation . Way 2
docs.title: Mkdocs Github deploy
